isis.stitle: TSI 96-08-09 - PTO Disengagement When 4-Way Flashers Are Turned On

subjectgroup.subject: PTO Disengagement When 4-Way Flashers Are Turned On

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 2000, 4000 and 8000 models equipped with PTO, air brakes, Navistar electronic engine, and International turn signal switch.

Vehicles as described above experience PTO disengagement when the 4-way flashers (hazard) are applied. The International turn signal switch has a brake override feature which gives stop lamp indication at the rear of the vehicle even with the 4-way flasher on. The engine electronics cannot determine if the signal it receives is a result of brake or 4-way application and consequently disengages the PTO.
This instruction covers modification of the vehicle wiring system so that the 4-way flashers will not cause the PTO to disengage.

note.para: This modification is only necessary in applications where the customer requires simultaneous operation of the PTO and 4-way flashers.
Refer to Electronic Circuit Diagram Book CTS-5122T in Group 08 of the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Install feed eyelet of circuit (14Y) to feed stud (J1) located over the fuse block assembly.
Disconnect turn signal switch connector (459). Connect the male and female side of connector (459) to the tee connector of the overlay harness 3508177C91.
At brake switch relay (383), REMOVE CIRCUIT (97K) terminal from relay connector and insulate with tape.
Insert circuit (14Z) terminal of the relay harness into the open cavity created by the removal of circuit (97K).
Insert circuit (70B) terminal of the overlay harness into the remaining open cavity of the brake switch relay.
Strap up and secure all loose cables. Position cables so that they are not routed over sharp surfaces and do not come in contact with any moving parts.
Connect battery negative cable and test for proper operation of turn signals, 4-way flasher, stop lamp operation and operation of the PTO with 4-way flasher operating.

note.para: Brake application will disengage the PTO; 4-way flasher operation will not disengage the PTO.
